title: VA NEWS | Yearlong VA Community Care and Discounted Life Insurance for Veterans
summary:
The VA is simplifying your care with yearlong authorizations for specialized community care, eliminating the need to reapply every few months. This includes 30 types of care like cardiology and mental health, giving you uninterrupted treatment.
 
Additionally, the VA is offering discounted life insurance premiums through Veterans’ Group Life Insurance (VGLI) and Family Servicemembers’ Group Life Insurance (FSGLI). Eligible Veterans, service members, and their families can now access affordable, long-term financial protection, with easy transitions from SGLI to VGLI—no medical exam needed.
 
Contact your local VA Medical Center Community Care Office or visit va.gov to check eligibility for yearlong authorizations. Learn more and apply for VA life insurance at benefits.va.gov/insurance.
 
Your health and peace of mind matter—let VA help you protect them!
 
#Veterans #VA #VABenefits #Healthcare #LifeInsurance #CommunityCare

title: Minnesota's Conspiracy Exposed: Don Lemon's Role?
summary:
Minnesota's Conspiracy Exposed: Don Lemon's Role?

Join us on Minneapolis as we delve into the rapidly escalating conflict between federal ICE operations and coordinated local resistance. In this episode, we explore the contentious involvement of figures like Don Lemon. With revelations from infiltrated chat groups, we expose the deep ties between Democratic officials and anti-ICE activists, uncovering allegations of conspiracy and federal law violations. Featuring insights from various sources and ongoing investigations, this episode provides a penetrating look at modern-day 'resistance' movements and the legal ramifications for those involved.

title: Aging Strong with VA: Geriatric Patient Aligned Care Team (GeriPACT)
summary: In this first episode of Aging Strong with VA, the series introduces VA programs designed to support aging Veterans and their caregivers. In this episode Deputy Secretary Paul R. Lawrence, Ph.D., focuses on the Geriatric Patient Aligned Care Team (GeriPACT), a team-based primary care model for Veterans with complex medical needs. He explains how coordinated care teams help improve communication, continuity of care, and overall health outcomes. Viewers learn who GeriPACT is for and how it supports Veterans in maintaining independence and quality of life.

title: Teen Mental Health and School-Based Services in California
summary: About 3 in 10 California teens report serious psychological distress, yet significant gaps exist between the need for mental health care and receipt of services. This report examines teen mental health and access to care across demographic groups and describes how state and district funding have expanded school-based solutions.

source: Publication Archive - Public Policy Institute of California
title: Policy Brief: Teen Mental Health and School-Based Services in California
summary: Rates of chronic sadness and suicidal thoughts in teens have been rising in California—and nationwide—since about 2009. Significant gaps exist between the reported need for mental health care and receipt of services. The state has recently invested $8 billion for child and teen mental health, including school-based services.

title: EPS: Veteran Community Care Scheduling Made Simple
summary: External Provider Scheduling (EPS) makes scheduling Veterans’ appointments fast and straightforward. Once EPS is securely integrated with your existing system, appointments are booked right into your practice’s calendar. This means fewer phone calls with VA. All you have to do is decide what availability to share. To get started, email EPSProvider@va.gov

title: State Policymakers Discuss Priorities, Challenges for 2026
summary: Affordability is a top issue for policymakers from both parties, along with AI and immigration. Heath Flora, Republican leader of the California State Assembly, and Democratic Assemblymember José Luis Solache, Jr., discuss their concerns with PPIC president and CEO Tani Cantil-Sakauye.

source: The Official United States Marine Corps Public Website News
title: 2nd Marine Logistics Group 3D printed Drone
summary: Sgt. Henry David Volpe, an automotive maintenance technician with 2nd Marine Logistics Group, has successfully developed HANX, the Marine Corps’ first NDAA-compliant, 3D-printed drone platform. Developed at the II MEF Innovation Campus in just 90 days, the HANX drone represents a major leap in tactical manufacturing by providing a low-cost, modular system that is resilient against adversary software. By utilizing 3D printing and off-the-shelf parts that meet rigorous security standards, Sgt. Volpe and his team have moved drone production from external contractors directly into the hands of Marines. This "by Marines, for Marines" innovation aligns with the Department of War’s "Drone Dominance" initiative, offering a versatile tool for reconnaissance or one-way attack missions that can be built and modified anywhere in the fleet.

title: Glad You Asked: Digital GI Bill
summary: In this episode of Glad You Asked, Deputy Secretary Paul R. Lawrence, Ph.D., explains how the Digital GI Bill is transforming the way Veterans access their education benefits. He answers common questions from student Veterans, walks through the information needed to apply, and shows how some Veterans are now receiving decisions within seconds thanks to improved online tools and streamlined processes.

title: Implementing California’s Child Welfare Prevention Services Program
summary: This report discusses ongoing implementation of California’s Family First Prevention Services program since 2021-22. The report provides background regarding California’s child welfare system and how it is funded, describes the Department of Social Services’ progress in developing and overseeing the state’s new child welfare prevention services program, describes counties’ plans for implementing child welfare prevention services at the local level—as well as some challenges they have faced—and provides some considerations and options for the Legislature moving forward.

title: Who’s Leaving California—and Who’s Moving In?
summary: Almost 10 million people have moved from California to other states since 2010, while just over 7 million people moved to California from other parts of the country. Lower-income households have been much more likely to leave the state than higher-income households.

title: 31st MEU | U.S. Marines, Sailors Honor Legacy of Operation Swift During Battlefield Visit in Vietnam
summary: From January 9–11, 2026, U.S. Marines and Sailors assigned to the 31st Marine Expeditionary Unit (MEU) conducted a battlefield visit to the site of Operation Swift, a pivotal engagement of the Vietnam War, to honor the legacy of those who fought there and to reflect on the enduring bonds between past and present generations of service members. During the Vietnam War, Marine forces conducted amphibious and helicopter-borne operations as part of Special Landing Force Alpha, including during Operation Swift, employing integrated air, ground, and logistics elements in combat that reinforced the MAGTF construct and helped shape the MEU’s role as a forward-deployed, rapid-response force.

title: Janneck Peersman Joins Intact
summary:
Intact, an inspection, audit, certification, and standards software company, has announced the appointment of Janneck Peersman as Vice President of Customer Success and Market Strategy. Peersman, who has a wealth of experience in the testing, inspection, and certification (TIC) sector, is uniquely positioned to drive forward the company’s continuous improvement efforts. He brings Intact deep […]

Janneck Peersman Joins Intact on The Auditor.

title: CA SB892
summary:
An act to amend, repeal, and add Section 66025.8 of the Education Code, relating to public postsecondary education.

2026/01/15 From printer. May be acted upon on or after February 14.

title: California’s Population
summary: More people live in California than any other state. Growth has slowed dramatically over the past quarter century, but the state’s population is still one of the most diverse in the nation.

source: The Official United States Marine Corps Public Website News
title: Tripoli Expeditionary Strike Group operates in 7th Fleet
summary: The Tripoli Expeditionary Strike Group, composed of the 31st Marine Expeditionary Unit (MEU), America-class amphibious assault ship USS Tripoli (LHA 7), Ticonderoga-class guided-missile cruiser USS Robert Smalls (CG 62) and Arleigh Burke-class guided-missile destroyer USS Rafael Peralta (DDG 115), is conducting routine operations in the U.S. 7th Fleet area of operations, Dec. 11.

title: The Year Ahead for the California Legislature
summary: How can California legislators work across the aisle to solve our state's most pressing issues? Join PPIC president and CEO Tani Cantil-Sakauye for a wide-ranging conversation with Assembly Republican Leader Heath Flora and Democratic Assemblymember José Luis Solache, Jr.

title: The 2026-27 Budget: Overview of the Governor's Budget
summary:
On January 9, 2026, Governor Newsom’s administration presented its proposed state budget to the California Legislature. In this report, we provide a high-level summary and our initial analysis of the Governor’s budget based on our preliminary review (as of January 10).

title: Put SQF Unites on Your 2026 Calendar
summary:
A new year brings new priorities, and now is the perfect time to plan for how you’ll prepare for SQF Code, Edition 10. Edition 10 places a stronger emphasis on how food safety programs perform in practice, not just how they’re documented. With a focus on practical application, SQF Unites 2026 brings concepts to life with […]

Put SQF Unites on Your 2026 Calendar on The Auditor.
